meanings.sent1: The teacher predetermines the seating arrangement before the first day of school.
meanings.sent2: She always predetermines what movie they will watch on movie night.
meanings.sent3: His habit of predetermining his outfit for the week led to some interesting fashion choices.
meanings.sent4: The weather forecast predetermines whether we will have a picnic or stay indoors.
meanings.sent5: The fortune teller's prediction seemed to predetermine the outcome of the game.

meanings.sent1: The chef predetermines the menu for the week to ensure smooth operations.
meanings.sent2: They predetermine the route they will take before starting the road trip.
meanings.sent3: Her decision to predetermine her answers for the test backfired when the questions were changed.
meanings.sent4: The ancient prophecy seemed to predetermine the fate of the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's research findings predetermine the course of future experiments.
